title: [Large-Scale] Augmented Reality-Based Design Theory and Foundational Learning Course

context.prior_knowledge: Basic design terminology and fundamental computer literacy skills
context.additional_context: The learner is a design field job seeker requiring applied learning in the language domain (design terminology). The course is structured as a blended format combining AR content using personal devices (BYOD) and face-to-face workshops.

learning_goals: Learners can explain the five basic design principles (balance, emphasis, contrast, rhythm, and unity) through AR content with over 80% accuracy.
Learners can execute the process of applying principles to real-world design problems using AR simulation tools at least three times.
Formative assessments (quizzes, peer feedback) improve understanding of design theory by over 30% compared to pre-assessments.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
